DOC.brief_summary: The goal research study learn eating practice survivor childhood Central Nervous System ( CNS ) tumor ( include brain spinal cord tumor ) . Recent research show childhood cancer survivor experience many health issue month even year active cancer treatment ( example , irregular blood sugar level , overweight/obesity , heart disease ) . To address grow concern , researcher MD Anderson Children 's Cancer Hospital Texas Children 's Cancer Center join force learn design program would promote healthy lifestyle among survivor childhood cancer .
DOC.brief_title: MyChoice : An Application Three-Factor Eating Questionnaire ( TFEQ-R18v2 ) Among Adolescent Young Adult Survivors Central Nervous System ( CNS ) Tumors
DOC.detailed_description: A one-time assessment conduct participant Assessment Center website . No treatment intervention provide . Two website set ( Site A Site B ) . The difference two site order question appear . The actual question remain . Only adolescent young adult ( AYA ) survivor CNS tumor eligible screen invite respond survey . Following final screening , eligible participant randomize Site A Site B . Each participant complete web-based questionnaire total 53 question . For site A , order question TFEQ-R18v2 , multifactor screener , EQ-EMA . For site B , order question EQ-EMA , multifactor screener , TFEQ-R18v2 . The 53 question come original TFEQ-R18v2 , multifactor screener use National Cancer Institute 's Observing Protein Energy Nutrition Study , adapt TFEQ-R18v2 use via EMA methodology . Multifactor screener short assessment tool use evaluate dietary intake fruit , vegetable , percentage energy fat , fiber . Eating Questionnaire-EMA ( EQ-EMA ) adapt base original TFEQ-R18v2 use via EMA methodology . The change make related change verbiage reflect goal assess participant 's current behavior eat episode .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Adolescent Young Adult ( AYA ) , 15 39 year old survive primary CNS tumor 2 . Has therapy without relapse least 6 month 3 . Able speak , write , read English 4 . Has access internet 5 . Has telephone access 6 . Currently live United States 1 . Is foster care 2 . Is experience severe cognitive impairment allow engage basic conversation [ We exclude individual may experience severe cognitive impairment participant need provide assent ( < 18 year old ) consent ( > =18 year old ) need ability independently complete TFEQR18v2 , Multifactor screener , EQEMA .
